name: Warner Bembridge Coast Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great weekend break, I think this was our 5th break at Bembridge and it never disappoints. No problems with car parking and a nice touch to have complimentary hot cross buns on arrival on Good Friday. On entering our room we also each had a cadbury easter egg as well as the usual tea/coffee/biscuits. Our request for a window table in the dining room had been noted and our waiter (Massimo) was brilliant, even accepting requests for extra dessert!! All the food we had was really good. (Another Easter egg provided at breakfast on Sunday!)
reviews.title: Eggcellent Easter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The evening entertainment was great (we did our own thing during the day, swimming/pitch and putt/walking on the lovely beach) especially Clem Curtis. We had seen him before at Bembridge a couple of years ago. That time the power all went out after about 2 songs but instead of giving up he grabbed an acoustic guitar and came onto the dance floor to sing, a true professional. Our signature room was kept spotless and a smell of drains was dealt with as soon as reported.
reviews.title: Our Honeymoon................

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only (minor) negatives are that the putting area and grass at the front of the coffee lounge appear to be a public right of way so there were numerous children/dogs/cyclists using the area. I even spotted a car parking by Hollywood House and unloading kids with bikes.However, all the people we saw were very well behaved so not really a problem. Also the ladies changing room at the pool was not very clean, the drain area by the shower was full of hair. The pool itself was fine.
reviews.title: Hollywood house, just say no!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Keep up the good work Bembridge, we have already booked for September (another Motown weekend) and can't wait.
reviews.title: A Great Weeekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couldn't afford to go abroad but as we had to go on a ferry it was the next best thing. Had a lovely room and the food was amazing. Felt like we were the youngest ones there but at least that meant there were no kids making a noise.
reviews.title: Excellent standards maintained

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel in a quiet spot right on the sea front. It would be difficult if you did not have a car but that was not a problem for myself and 3 girlfriends. We have been to Warner's before and we think this was definitely the best yet. The staff were lovely, particularly the entertainment team who were excellent, very talented and working so hard. The restaurant was also very nice, food is not cordon bleu but plenty of choice and we enjoyed it and perhaps ate too much! The only criticism we could find was that the star show "The Beach Bouys" were a little too full of their own importance. They should have been appearing on Saturday night but this was changed to Sunday night at 9.30pm. The entertainment team did a great job to get everyone into a great party mood and then the curtains opened to .......... nothing. The DJ valiantly played four Beach Boy numbers to cover the delay but eventually the audience started the slow handclap and eventually they came out,20 minutes late, no apology but just grumbles because we were not too receptive to them. They are a good group but everyone was moaning about their arrogance. They might only be performing in front of a Warner's audience but perhaps someone should tell them that without us they would not get paid!!!!! The fact that 3 of the group were seen in the bar before the performance and all their equipment was on stage and ready for them suggests that perhaps they were not over keen to perform for us oldies.. But apart from that, well done Bembridge Coast Hotel, it was a great weekend.
reviews.title: Great weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a long weekend stay at Bembridge on the weekend of the Queens Diamond Jubilee.
reviews.title: Another Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As expected we had a great weekend with an excellent room and great entertainment and a great outside party entertainment on the day of the celebrations.
reviews.title: Bembridge Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only minor fault I can think of was that my Chicken Curry was sub-standard with 'chicken on the bones???' (all bones with very little meat) and they had run out of Nan bread; however that is being a bit picky as the rest of the food over the weekend was excellent.
reviews.title: Not bad but a bit isolated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (Signature room) was overlooking the sea on the east side and was very clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: fantastic weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: celebration Birthday weekend for me and my two sisters and hisbands. lovely location, comfortable rooms but restaurant horrendous, packed with insufficient staff, mostly buffet type food, boring menu, huge queues. breakfast the worse, queues queuse and more queues.
reviews.title: very dissapointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Entetainment venue packed, difficult to find a seat, could not see entetainment and could not get back to the bar once you were there.
reviews.title: just what we wanted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: would not return
reviews.title: Worst of all the Warner Premier Resorts - For OAPs only

likes.liked: — The Royal Room was clean, tidy and had nice views
likes.disliked: — The fact that everything is aimed at OAPs, The dire Room Service, not to the same standard as the other warner premier resorts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: very expensive for what it is.
reviews.title: Perfect location, friendly staff

likes.liked: — clean well designed rooms, lovely garden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: not value for money, look for good hotels in location you like.
reviews.title: Bembridge Coast - A haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As a couple or in a group Lovely Place overlooking the sea (well our room was). Our 2nd time here andf as always, food excellent and well catered for all, resturant couldn't be more pleasant. We was in a group of 10 so it didn't matter about entertainment, but what was on was ok.
reviews.title: Great short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely setting, walks along the beach lovely and a couple of good pubs either side of the Hotel, The Crab and Anchor being one.
reviews.title: Hollywood Royale room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just back from a 4 night stay.
reviews.title: not happy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked a Royale room for the extra space and big bed and were put into room 705 in the Hollywood lodge. No sea view but lovely and quiet.This is a lovely green tiled building about 100 yds from the main hotel.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT AND HARD TO FAULT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a bit disappointed to find the bed was only a standard double and the room a bit on the small side.
reviews.title: Dance Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a very enjoyable weekend break here in May, as you would expect from Warner's food was excellent and the ambience in the Restaurant is first class.
reviews.title: Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a standard room and we cannot fault it.
reviews.title: A vast improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside to the Hotel we thought was that the main entertainment could do with updating.
reviews.title: Great location
Superb stay at this lovely resort
reviews.text: After the first nights cabaret which was outstanding, we were quite disappointed on the Saturday night which was a Bavarian (so called) beer band, very amateur..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I reviewed another Warner hotel a few months ago - Thoresby Hall - and rated it very low.
reviews.title: Easter at Bembridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: "You can't please all of the people all of the time". The truth of this is borne out both by other reviews and by our own experience at the Bembridge Coast. To describe the food as awful, as one reviewer has, is a travesty. We found it good, some of it very good, and the service in the restaurant was excellent. Our Swedish waiter, Philip, was a delight and Adrian (South African), his stand-in on his day off was.....well, amazing. A wide choice is offered, although if you ate late they did run out of some starters and sweets rather too frequently - probably a consequence of everything being seemingly run by Head Office accountants. We were given complimentary drinks to compensate for this (without asking). If the accountants knew this happened maybe they wouldn't run out so often!
reviews.title: A different experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That you can't please all of the people was also borne out by the entertainment. We happened to be there when someone we apparently should have heard of was starring in the Saturday cabaret. To our amazement guests were missing their dinner in order to queue for the best seats. We thought he was awful. By contrast we enjoyed the two unheard-of comedians we saw during the week and the two shows put on by the in-house entertainment team.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: So why was this "a different experience"? Well, we hadn't read any of the reviews beforehand and didn't realise exactly what "adults only" meant. The four of us are in our early 60's but must have been pretty well the youngest there, particularly mid-week when the coach parties arrived. The hotel even has its own large supply of wheelchairs! Was this a problem? Not really, as long as one successfully dodged the odd mobility scooter, but the (very) few younger guests did look a bit fazed at times. One positive advantage was that very few guests used the sporting facilities and we had the pitch and putt course (which could have been better maintained) and the indoor swimming pool virtually to ourselves - just as well in the case of the pool as it is only 12.5 metres long and is also used by local residents who belong to the Warner Leisure Club. Those accountants again!
reviews.title: A very enjoyable Easter Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All in all, this is a cross between an old folks home and an up-market holiday camp. Generally well maintained and with friendly staff and in a superb location (although not a good swimming beach). Whether it is worth the money probably depends on the deal you get. Those accountants seem to make sure everyone gets some sort of discount from the published tariff with the end result that no-one knows where they are.
reviews.title: Can't Wait To Go Back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Would I go there again? Possibly. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? Probably not (unless he's an accountant!)
reviews.title: Brilliant Break

likes.liked: — Everything, views, food, dancing, staff, entertainment, leisure suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our third visit, the food seems to have got even better & there were no problems with dishes running out like on previous trips. Our waitress, Julie, was fantastic - efficient & very friendly.
reviews.title: Our third enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The named act "Jimmy James & the Vagabonds" was superb. Had everyone up dancing (ok, I was one of the first!) & really made the holiday.
reviews.title: It does what it says on the packet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We tried archery & really enjoyed it, especially the helpful leisure staff. We also enjoyed the new falconry display.
reviews.title: A lovely short break in a clean, comfortable hotel with good food and friendly, helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only disappointment was that we were allocated a room in Hollywood House. This is a long way from the main hotel & while we were happy with Lege House nearby last time, I would avoid Hollywood. The rooms are much bigger, but seemed older & smelled musty. We were able to change to an Ambassador room in the main hotel, but only because other clients had to leave unexpectedly. As it was the only room available, we had to accept single beds instead of the double we booked. We were disappointed as we'd hope as guests who stay every year, and intend to carry on doing so, we wouldn't be stuck out the back in a room they obviously only use when the hotel is fully booked. It wasn't the most relaxing start to our break, waiting to change rooms, moving luggage etc, so it would have been nice to have been offered something as way of an apology like a bottle of wine etc, but nothing was forthcoming.
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: So I'd advise anyone to check your confirmation really carefully and avoid Hollywood House. I'd also try to get rooms on the first floor, not the second, as they have much bigger windows. Our new room was OK, apart from single beds. Very clean with a good bathroom.
reviews.title: Nicely situated and lots of activities on offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right on the coast, this is a lovely hotel with well decorated, modern rooms and good food. Warner serves an older market of guests so expect ballroom dancing and bingo in the evenings but if you don't mind that you'll love the good food - much of which is buffet style and the stunning location - you can't get much closer to the sea than this.
reviews.title: Perfect setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I feel that previous reviewers of this Hotel have concentrated on one thing, the large amount of grey hair present. This is true, but I don't see how this impacts on individuals holidays. I stayed in one of the 'recently refurbished' signature rooms which had a lovely shower and mainly was very clean and pleasant. The one exception was that there was some of the ceiling paint was flaking, maybe the contractor had not applied it properly. The food is buffet style and very good quality, there are a couple of choices that can be ordered at the table. Drinks are a bit pricey and only two pubs in walking distance, so not many alternatives. You have to be in the lounge early to get good seats for the shows( you may have to sit through the bingo!). The entertainment put on by the in-house team is very good and better than the 'professional entertainers'
reviews.title: Good quality, but not for young people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Entertainment and staff very good. Food in restaurant faultless, considering they cater for such a high number.
reviews.title: Disappointed with room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Beautiful location. Our only gripe was the room. Appear to have been put in the run down section of the hotel called Ledge House. In need of major refurbishment. Website states the standard Ambassador room has having luxurious beds - what a joke. Both sides of the mattress had deep dips in. The wallpaper was stained, the carpet too. As for the old wooden windows - the frames were completely peeled of paint in some places, the windows did not shut properly and part of the frame which had obviously rotted had been replaced with an unpainted piece of wood. There was also mould around the bath. The shower made such a noise when turned on too. As it was our friends 20th wedding anniversary we did not feel we could complain. Would not have a problem with recommending this hotel but would suggest you make sure not in Ledge House.
reviews.title: standards have slipped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just come back from a fri to mon with friends this was my 4 visit in 9 years last time 2006 the standards have slipped awfully . i took advise from one of your letter writers and booked a signature room the decor was great and modern but carpet was dusty all around the edges toilet roll holder was hanging off bedroom ceiling was badly water stained . the whole hotel complex looks tired and need of t.l.c. the food is awful works canteen style when i told the waiter my soup was cold he said the microwave was broke and he could not do anythink about it . needless to say we will vote with our feet and never go here again
reviews.title: ADVERTISEMENT DOES NOT MATCH REALITY - BEWARE

aka: Warner Bembridge Coast Hotel Isle Of Wight
description: With spectacular views over The Solent, this secluded, shoreline Character Hotel is just the place to take in the sea air. As well as the sea views, enjoy the beautiful Spanish gardens and the indoor bowls complex. Midweek and Weekend breaks inclusive of breakfast and 3-course dining, live evening entertainment and extensive leisure activities.
